intro: Zollikoferia tenuiloba, commonly known as the slender swamp lily, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant features long, narrow leaves and produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in swampy areas and can be part of the understory vegetation in humid forests. Its botanical characteristics make it well-adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
